title: Cat. 59  Teakettle and Stand 1877/1889
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Design attributed to Edward C. Moore (American, 1827–1891)  
Tiffany & Co. (American, founded 1837)  
New York, New York  
Silver with copper; 23.9 × 11.9 cm (9 3/8 × 4 1/16 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Dorothy J. Vance  
Fund, 1986.407a–e

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom of teakettle (fig. 59.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Christie’s, 1986, lot 18, p. 15 (ill.).

With S. J. Shrubsole, Corp., New York, 1986.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1986.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, A Decade of Decorative Arts: The Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, November 12, 1986–January 4, 1987, p. 93, cat. 69 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Christie’s (1986), lot 18, pp. 32–33, 33 (ill.).

Naeve et al. (1986), p. 93, cat. 69 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Teakettle and Stand 1877/1889.

fig. 59.1 </section>
